page.title: 01A Word Picture of the Area
page.content: {A WORD PICTURE OF THE AREA} Our 4x3 grid consists of an area which includes large sections of two of {Woking's} old outlying villages, {Horsell and Chobham};and a smaller part of two other villages{Bisley}and {Knaphill.} These four are separated by a wedge of green land along the banks of the River Bourne,a tributary of the River Wey. The two former villages are old ones with a conservation area at the centre of each.They were probably built originally with locally made brick and the roads with flint and sand dug from the adjacent commons. To the South East corner of the area we have part of a large new development called{Goldsworth Park. This has been built on former nursery land.
